text: so secretary Cohen when you hear the
current defense secretary warning North
Korea not to consider actions that could
lead to the end of its regime and the
destruction of its people is that the
right tone to strike I think it is
because he's talking about actions it's
not something that I haven't said in the
past in all my years in dealing with
North Korea that if you ever attack the
South Korean Peninsula South Korean
allies Americans on that peninsula
Japan Guam United States we will respond
in a way that you no longer exist so
that that's a statement of fact but what
about the president's extremely fiery
rhetoric though I mean today we've had
his secretary of state in his defense
Oda having to follow his lead but what
about his tone well it's his tone but
also the language used he said if North
Korea continues to threaten our allies
well that's different than taking action
they are known for making threats that's
what they do they made a threat
immediately after he said that so when
you draw a line verbally or rhetorically
and saying if you make any more threats
against our allies will respond with
fire and fury well they just made a
threat now the question is where we
serious or were we bluffing or are we
misinterpreting what the president is
saying so we have to be clear the one
thing when you're dealing with war is
that you have to be very clear very
concise and precise and to the extent
you create ambiguity you enhance the
danger of miscalculation so I think what
secretary mattis said if you take any
actions which threaten us or our allies
it will be the end of your regime so he
was clear at least but the president
trades in bluster doesn't he much like
the North Koreans do so are we basically
ending up on their level well it's sort
of like schoolyard taunting my gun is
bigger and better than your gun is and I
think that words don't matter as much I
don't think we can threaten the North
Koreans that that will matter if we take
action for example as we did
diplomatically by squeezing them
economically if we put back in if the
right now the South Korean president has
put a hold on the sadness
the anti-missile system put that back on
track that is something that will get
the attention not only the North Koreans
but the Chinese have the Japanese do the
same so there are things that we can do
that will squeeze the North Korean
regime because they had the benefit of
having a guns and butter policy they've
had the guns and China and Russia and
others have given them the butter you
start taking the butter way they've got
to make a different calculation so I
think that the policy the president's
policy of squeezing em is the correct
one about threatening them with fire and
fury if they ever threaten make another
threat well that turns out to be an
empty threat one assistant to the
president said today that the
brinksmanship with North Korea was
comparable to the Cuban Missile Crisis
is that amping it up too much I don't
think it's comfortable at all I think at
the when you talk about the Russians
having a nuclear weapon in Cuba 90 miles
off the coast of Atlanta it's quite
different number two we don't know that
the North Koreans at this point in time
have a capability of putting a nuclear
missile together with a miniature
warhead that can strike all of the
United States they may get there and
that's the reason why we have to stop
them from going forward the way you stop
them is to again squeeze the economy
squeeze them diplomatically put in
defensive equipment in South Korea Japan
more so even in the United States that
we currently have but we have a defense
system so there are things that we can
do in the short term to really squeeze
them and I think secretary Tillerson to
set the right tone we're going to do
this working where the allies if it's
just us threatening them then I think it
causes more dissension more of a split
with us and our allies including the
South Koreans and secretary Kerry it
sounds like you feel there should be a
peaceful solution here it has to be one
we can't bomb a country into submission
if they attack us if they launch any
missile attack or bomb any any part of
our allies in US and obviously we're
going to respond with overwhelming force
but there needs to be a settlement of
the the entire agreement we need the
Chinese involve the Russians of all the
Japanese the South Koreans and the North
Koreans we can do that
